phrase.item: This story has endured from our Wakhi ancestors [down to today].
It happened back in that time.
Once upon a time there was a king.
The king had two daughters.
Year by year he got old and reached middle age.
He never had a son.
Then he brought the doctors and told his wife, "I brought you a doctor.
He is supposed to treat you. Maybe we will have a son."
The doctor came and made for her medicine out of herbs. Treated her [the king's wife].
Some times passed.
And [finally] the king had a son. They became very happy.
The king threw parties for seven days and nights.
Then [the king] named his son Kingir.
The king raised and pampered him, his son.
The [king] never went far from his son.
Year by year his son grew up.
Then he took him to study, took him to the scholars.
He did everything for [his son].
The king never wanted his son to be far from him.
So one time the king told his wife, "Let's do it this way, let's give Kingir a wife.
Otherwise, he will leave us".
His wife replied, "Okay".
Then they did "nikah" [wedding vows], him and a girl.
One day Kingir went to his father and asked him a question,
saying, "In this world is it good to travel or to eat [stay in one place and enjoy it]?"
His father said, "It is good to eat in this world".
If [the king] would say, it's good to travel the world, their son will leave them.
Kingir didn't say anything.
One day he went to the garden with his friends.
Then he asked the same question to his friends.
He asked, "Is it good to travel the world or to eat?"
His friends said, "It is good to travel the world."
He said, "My father told me that it is good to eat and drink in this world".
Then they said, "Hey, foolish one!
Your father doesn't want you to go away. from them.
You are their only son. That's why they are saying so.
Otherwise it's good to travel".
Then Kingir came to his mother, saying, "Ready my victuals [food for the road].
Early in the morning I will go for a journey.
His father said, "No, I won't permit you.
You shouldn't go. You are the only son we have.
Whom will you leave us if you go?"
He rejected this, saying, "No, I will go".
In the morning he gathered his victuals and left.
‎‎He rode on the horse.
His mother begged him. She cried, continuously repeating and saying, "Hey son don't go".
He didn't accept and left.
Then it came into his father's mind to say, "The girl with whom he did "nikah" I will send after him".
They told the girl and she went after him.
She went for a while like that [running]
The girl kept running like that after the guy.
Then she screamed, and the man heard a female voice, he stopped and was stayed in his spot.
He got off his horse and saw that girl [his wife].
From running the color of her face had turned yellow.
He asked, "Why are you running?
Why has your face changed to yellow?"
The girl said, "It's all because of you".
Then she collapsed on the spot and died
‎‎Kingir stared and didn't know what to do.
He didn't know what to do her.
He said [to himself], "What else can I do with her in this desert?"
He left her there and left.
Seven days in a row, day and night he was on the journey.
‎‎He got really tired.
He reached a city.
In that city he reached the edge of a river.
He went to the edge of the river and there was a sycamore.
[Someone] put a ladder up to the sycamore.
He tied his horse by the edge of the river.
He used the ladder and climbed up the sycamore.
There was a house built from wood.
That house belonged to that country's
king, so that king whenever he went for a journey, when he went hunting, he stayed in that house.
Then Kingir entered and he fell asleep inside [the house].
The king had a beautiful daughter.
Her servants used to bring her water from that river.
One day, on that day [the servants] came by the water.
They looked at the water and they saw a human [image].
That [person] was very pretty.
Then they said, "We are so beautiful. God has given us beauty as well, we are also pretty.
Why are we serving the king's daughter?"
They smashed their vases [of clay] into stones and broke them.
They returned with empty [hands].
The princess said, "Didn't you bring me water?'
‎‎They replied, "No!
Who are you that we should bring you water?
We are also beautiful like you.
We also have such beauty. Why do we have to serve you?"
At that moment, she had a servant and
her name was Bibi. She was very nimble. Her brain worked very quickly.
She said, "I will bring you water".
She took a mirror with her and left.

She went to the edge of the river. Then she looked at the image in the water. Then she looked at herself in amirror. ‎‎The image she saw in the water and the one in the mirror, ‎‎they were different from each other.
‎‎They didn't look the same at all.
‎‎She started wondering whose image could be in the water.
‎‎Then she saw in the water that sycamore, tree and the [reflection] of the wooden house was visible.
Up the ladder she climbed.
She saw a handsome boy was sleeping there.
She kept calling him and telling him to wake up, but he didn't wake up.
The [king's] daughter didn't say anything.
She returned back to her house late. The king's daughter spoke to her,
asking, "Why did you come late?"
She replied, "I cleaned the king's house on top of the sycamore by the river".
His daughter didn't say anything.
The next day came.
The next day, the girl went again. The guy was sleeping, again. She tried but the guy wouldn't wake up.
The servant went again and told the [king's] daughter, "I cleaned the house".
The king's daughter was surprised.
She said [to herself], "Up until today she didn't clean, These two days she has gone and cleaned the house.
‎‎Then she told her,
saying, "Whether you tell me the truth or I will give you a hard time".
As the girl was afraid of punishment, she told her her story, saying this is what happened.
One day when she was going for water, the king's daughter said, "I will also go with you",
‎‎and she went for water.
She climbed up the tree,
and she saw the boy, who was very handsome. When she saw him, she started shaking
because the boy was very handsome.
She ordered her servant, "Go and bring me water".
The servant went and brought her water in a pot.
The girl, the king's daughter, she dipped a flower in the water and hit the boy with that. The boy woke up.
‎‎And she asked, "Who are you?
Why did you come here?"
The [guy] told his [story],
saying, "I am a king's son.
‎‎I am such a person.
For a certain reason I came here.
I got very tired and taking a rest here".
The girl fell in love with that girl.
‎‎She took him with her,
saying, "I also have a castle.
I am also a king's daughter".
They took him to the castle. When the father became aware of his daughter, he took the man and put him in prison.
How much gold the king's daughter had, whatever wealth she had, she collected, them all and came to the prison's guard
"Set the man free!
saying, Let him go". The [guard] took the gold and let the man go. The girl again brought him to her castle.
Nobody was aware of their secret.
Some time passed and someone talked about it to the king.
The king came, the man was caught,
and he was ordered to be killed.
[The king] ordered him to be killed, his soldiers went and killed the man.
The girl cried a lot, begged her father and wailed a lot. Her father didn't listen to her.
The man was buried.
The girl kept crying and shed many tears.
She never smiled.
The king came to his daughter's place, saying, "You know that you are my only child.
You are my only one daughter.
I can do anything for you. I can find you a more handsome man than him, a more intelligent man I can find you."
The girl cried, saying, "I don't need anyone else.
I loved only him".
The king tried to hard [to make her smile] but couldn't.
Some time passed, the [princess] collected all her gold and other stuff
and took it all with her. She told her servants, "You go and ask permission from my father.
tell him, "Your daughter wants to go with us for water".
She [the servant] said, "Okay!" So they went. As her father loved his daughter so much, he gave her permission.
He said, "Okay, go".
She went with them and spread her gold everywhere.
So all the servants would go after [the gold].
In fact, when the servants saw the gold, they all were running after the gold and the girl ran away.
She went to the boy's grave.
Two flowers grew there. One flower was alive and the other one was dead.
‎‎Then she said, "Oh God,
why, when these flowers once grew the same, is one almost about to die.
There was a voice that came from the grave, saying, 'The living flower is you, beautiful like you.
The dead flower is me, as I have died because of you".
Then the grave opened wide and the girl entered into the grave next to the man and the grave closed by itself.
The worrying news had reached the castle that the girl had disappeared.
They went everywhere and searched for her, but couldn't find her.
The vizier was very smart.
He told the king,
"She was burning from the man's pain.
We will go and check in his grave."
People gathered and the soldiers went to the grave.
The grave was closed as it is supposed to be.
They said, "How can this can be so?"
The vezier said, "No worries, just open the grave".
They opened the grave and saw that those two were hugging each other and were dead.
The king said, "Do not leave my daughter's dead body with that man, make them separate".
Then they buried her next to the man.
Some time passed and in their graves trees grew.
After so many years, the king was told, "On top of your daughter's grave a tree has grown".
He went and saw the tree, from both the man and the girl's grave [trees] has grown.
They were twisted around each other.
The king said, "Because of this person I have lost my daughter.
Make the trees separate fully from each other".
The soldiers came and separated the trees from each other.
The trees turned into kabits (a kind of silver-colored bird).
They flew far away all over the world.
Then they reached Kingir's city.
There they came down to earth and turned [back] into humans.
When they turned into humans, Kingir knew where he was.
‎‎He asked the people there, "Where is the king of this country?
How is he?"
"He is in a bad situation now.
Now he is blind, he can't see and he is no longer the king".
[Kingir] was regretful and went to his house.
He saw his father, and that he had grown very old.
Then he asked his father, "Why did you become like that?"
The [old man] said, "Only God knows and is aware of my situation, nobody else knows.
Kingir made me so, because of him I became like this. I became old and blind from crying".
Then Kingir asked, "If you see your son now, will you be able to recognize him?"
The king replied, "Your voice is very similar to his [voice].
But unfortunately I cannot see you.
I should be able to know him if I see him. he is my child".
Then Kingir cried for a while and then said [to himself], "I need to do something".
Then he took his hands and applied them to [his father's] eyes.
His father was able to see.
He was able to see and recognized his son. They hugged each other. As they had missed each other for so many years, now they cried. So now they became young again.
That man became the king again in his place.
As for the girl's father, the king had thought they were dead.
He didn't know that they were living in Kingir's city.
So they all came to that city and lived there together.
They were all happy with each other.
The end!
